posts.name: Tucker
posts.cooked:
So we are currently using Pathplanner with YAGSL for our robot. Here is a link to the repository now: GitHub - rhit-martintd/2025-YAGSL . We had to redo our swerve drive, so we started using the YAGSL template. We are currently seeing a difference from what Pathplanner is thinking we doing and what were actually doing. When we go from the side of the field to the reef we are about 8 inches short but parallel to the reef. A visual of what were seeing can be see below. The white outline is where we stopped and red is where we said we would stop. I will also note that changing the PID values for AutoBuilder had no impact on the robot’s response.

Current setup: YAGSL with Pathplanner RoboRio 2.0 Pigeon 2 Swerve is SKS MK4n L3 with billet wheels

Things we have done: Verified pathplanner settings Changed PID values to “extreme” (We think) Checked we travel 3 meters in a straight line and got 3 meters. Set acceleration to be very low (.1 m/s^2) to eliminate wheel slip

Any ideas would be appreciated

I think your trackwidth and/or your robotwidth and robotlength in PathPlanner settings are wrong.

"holonomicMode": true,

"pathFolders": [],

"autoFolders": [],

"defaultMaxVel": 2.25,

"defaultMaxAccel": 0.8,

"defaultMaxAngVel": 540.0,

"defaultMaxAngAccel": 720.0,

"defaultNominalVoltage": 12.0,

"robotMass": 51.256,

"robotMOI": 4.59,

"robotTrackwidth": 0.546,

"driveWheelRadius": 0.0508,

"driveGearing": 5.36,

"maxDriveSpeed": 4.92,

"driveMotorType": "NEO",

"driveCurrentLimit": 40.0,

"wheelCOF": 0.8,

"flModuleX": 0.3,

"flModuleY": 0.284,

"frModuleX": 0.3,

"frModuleY": -0.284,

posts.name: Tucker
posts.cooked: So for the robotTrackWidth, do you need to set that in the Pathplanner GUI config or is that a property that has to be handled in the file directly?

posts.name: Tucker
posts.cooked:
Follow up to that, would we want to tune YAGSL PID values for swerve or tune Pathplanner PID values? The Pathplanner PID values feel as if we have no effect on the response of the robot.

When watching Pathplanner telementary we couldn’t see a different in changing PID for Pathplanner.

posts.name: ErikSLee
posts.cooked: We have noticed the same thing. Even putting in extreme changes in the PP PID values seems to have no impact on the outputs.

posts.name: Tucker
posts.cooked: Possibly someone with more experience in YAGSL OR Pathplanner be able to give some advice. I’ve even thought maybe units are an issue and started doing thousands and saw no difference. Anyone able to shed light on this or point in the correct direction? @nstrike ?
